page.title: 14ASHDOWN FOREST FIRES
page.content: Because of its easy proximity to London and it association with A.A.Milne, Ashdown Forest attracts large numbers of visitors, often in excess of 45,000 on a single day. Such numbers cause problems in regard to fire,erosion,litter and parking space. Fires mostly started accidentally are the main reason why the Forest is not covered by Birch and Pine woodland. Fire alters the pattern of vegetation; heather and gorse are replaced by bracken and grass, which escape fire damage because of their root system. Dead grass and bracken increase the risk of fire but provide better grazing. Heather withstands trampling, grass takes over if trampling is severe enough, grass may then die and erosion takes place. Such damaged tracks are temporarily closed.
